result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya M. Hinkle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $ TBD    plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Vernon P, his family or residence, Piggly Wiggly, Roberta Y or Elizabeth H, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Huber and Work Crew allowed.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condtion of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

May not have contact with Vernon P's family, Piggly Wiggly, Roberta Y, or Elizabeth H, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
ALL UNPAID FINE/COSTS ARE STILL DUE.
ALL UNPAID RESTITUTION IS STILL DUE.

Conditions of Extended Supervision
no contact with Vernon P's family, Piggly Wiggly, Roberta Y, or Elizabeth H.  kmk
7 yrs WSP; 4 yrs Initial Confinement followed by 3 yrs ES.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney James Ermert.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with vitim rights notification and statement given by Cory S. on behalf of victim.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is sentenced to 7 years in the WSP forthwith; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.   DE is given credit for 249 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Unpaid costs and restitution remaining shall be paid during extended supervision.  No contact with Vernon P.'s family, Piggly Wiggly, Roberta Y. or Elizabeth H.  Appeal Rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Tonya M. Hinkle, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre. Clerk: PT
State is complaint with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 120 days in the KCJ commencing on 9/17/16 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized.  15CF1213, 15CM1234 & 16CF280 are Concurrent.  DE is contesting the restitution that is being sought in this case so a Restitution Hearing is to be scheduled before Comm. Dowse.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs & surcharge.  Any balance of Cash Bond that remains in 15CM1234 & 16CF280 is to be applied and if any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Vernon P., Roberta Y. or Elizabeth H. or Piggly Wiggly.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Tonya M. Hinkle, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1, 3 and 4 - Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
& Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Trigg

15CF1213/15CM1234/16CF280

Court sets 15CF1213 for trial and 15CM1234 & 16CF280 will trail at this time.  Scheduling order is given in 15CM1234.  Parties are instructed to submit a letter or email to the court by 1PM on 7/21/16 in place of a jury status.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Celebre requests time to review discovery with def.  FPT 3/3/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Defendant, Tonya M. Hinkle, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:20 am.
